website_summaries.verdict: Safe for babies and parents, this option is virtually impenetrable and is designed without a threshold to prevent potentially nasty trips and tumbles.
pros: Robust steel frame with a secure lock doesn't budge under pressure
Entire gate swings open, creating a wide walkway
No bottom bar to trip over
One handed opening mechanism is ideal for caregivers who already have their hands full
Easy on the eyes, with clean lines and a bronze finish
cons: Some parts are made of plastic and aren't as sturdy as the rest

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: So frustrating. You have to lift to open the gate and the bottom latch doesn’t lock right away (you have to pull really hard bc the bottom peg needs to push past the lock). Installation was painful and I had to redrill twice despite following the template provided exactly. I wish I could return but I no longer have the box. I’ve been using it for about a month and it’s only gotten worse. The pegs at the top get loose despite frequently tightening the nut. It’s nice not having a bar to step over but that’s about the only thing I like about it. I’ll try to upload some pictures soon.
customer_reviews.author: laura chang

customer_reviews.title: Latch=Junk & UNSAFE! Why is it rated so high?! Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been using this for 6.5 mo. During installation it was VERY difficult to line up the latches so the bolt used in the locking mechanism would lock the gait into place despite following the directions & using template. The latch mechanism is very poor & NO longer works at all. For the past few mo. latching it has required several attempts & once latched, the bolt will POP OUT of place w/o any contact w/it! We know what to look for now & we check the latch every time we walk by the gait b/c so often it has been found to unlatch itself! Please don’t buy this UNSAFE baby gait!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice strong gate
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, opens and closes easily with one hand (or two hands if you have arthritis), best of all replacement parts are available on their website. The instructions are fine, just read them and think through everything before you start drilling holes. Comes with a template for mounting, but it’s not really necessary. Easier with two people, but this exhausted, stressed, sleep deprived puppy owner managed it in less than an hour alone. If you have to fasten it to drywall use VERY strong anchors, not the cheap ones. These Togglers work well:
customer_reviews.author: RandomPerson42

customer_reviews.title: What a Boondoggle
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but I had to on this one. I spent my whole day installing this piece of junk. I finally finished after following the sideways directions and completely incorrect diagram you are supposed to line it up with. I watched the video stating it was “easy to install”, yeah ok. It doesn’t latch correctly and a child could totally pull or push this thing open no problem. I don’t think it’s a safe product for my son who is nearing his crawling/walking stage. I hope this helps some of you and I apologize to the company for a bad review but it was a pretty frustrating day.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Match our black railings perfectly
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic! I did hours of research before selecting these baby gates. We have wrought iron railings and I wanted a baby gate that match them. The color said it was bronze but they look almost black to me, which is what I wanted. They are very easy to open and close with one hand and can swing both directions or one direction depending on your preference. We put one at the bottom of the steps that only opens in one direction and one at the top of the steps that swings in both directions. They have very tight latches and feel very secure!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay B.

customer_reviews.title: Great gate!
customer_reviews.text: I love this gate. We installed quickly and without too much trouble. My only issue with it was that when I opened it it wouldnt open all the way. There is a "lip" on either side of the hinge which prevented the gate to open completely. It was an easy enough fix for us, we just cut off the "lip" on the side where we wanted the gate to open. so now the gate opens completely. I included pics of the "lip" and also of the side with the "lip" removed. I love how it looks and it opens easily for us but the kids cant figure it out at all.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Smith

customer_reviews.title: Ideal option but...
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy construction. Mostly metal except wall connections. Does it’s job well. Toddler can help close but NOT open. Looks great. Two minor complaints. First, There are some adjustable screws that serve as part of the latch and allow flexibility to make the gate fit most gaps. There are some fasteners that help hold these screws in place and they constantly loosen no matter how hard you tighten. Mostly an aesthetic issue but annoying. Second, be sure you fasten into wood or a stud and that you account for length of drywall. Included screws could have been a little longer to improve durability but nothing has broken lose.
customer_reviews.author: JMay

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to measure.
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these gates for my back porch. It works wonderfully, so I ordered one for my front porch. That opening is wider which made me have to extend the gate as far as it could go. When you do that, you can't use the clamps that come with it to stop the gate from sliding back and forth. I had to use zip ties around the middle of it and that makes it pretty flimsy. I'm still using it, but I'm not really satisfied with it. It's a good gate. Just make sure your opening is a few inches less than full extension and it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Effective, elegant and efficient (needed another e-word)!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, elegant and highly adjustable. The manufacturer has excellent customer service. We ordered two Gates and one was missing screws (Amazon open box, but was to have included all hardware.) But the Manufacturer promptly mailed us an entire new hardware kit, no charge. It keeps our puppy (Doberman) and 13mth old in their respective spaces beautifully! The only reason it's not a four star is because the stencil diagram is not entirely accurate on the LATCH side. Now this could be because my spaces are not plum, their diagram is off, or the distance the gate spans makes it off. Who knows, just becareful, mount the hinge side and access whether the diagram is going to work.
customer_reviews.author: Daskys

customer_reviews.title: Great gate to keep out our Vizala/Lab
customer_reviews.text: We needed this dog gate to be able to keep our door open to allow air flow through the house but did not want to allow our dog to wander all over the house with the doors open as she is getting older and leaves us little presents from time to time. This gate is fabulous!! It opens large enough to cover our double doors and opens wide enough when it is open to be out of the way. The cats and dog have already learned they can see through it but cannot leave the room. :)
customer_reviews.author: HappyGma

customer_reviews.title: Excellent baby gate for Grandparents!
customer_reviews.text: This baby gate is a huge improvement from our old bulky and impossible to open unless you gave it a big jerk with both hands old one. This baby gate is installed at the top of our stairs. It is installed so that when the grandchildren are not here, it is left open, out of the way. When they are here, it clicks easily closed. It can easily, really and truly, be opened with one hand! No more inappropriate language while yanking and jerking trying to open the old stupid gate! I very highly recommend this baby gate, especially for grandparents on highly traveled stairs. It works easily on either side, without a landing.
customer_reviews.author: bird song

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I looked at so many baby gates for the top of stairs and we tried this one. So far, so good! It is attached to two walls, and it’s so nice to just close without messing with a latch. It does open wide so make sure you have room for the door to swing. My 1 year old has tested it and it seems very sturdy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Height is more like 36", not 31"
customer_reviews.text: Would have given 5 all around, but my husband had to do some engineering to make it work. The description says 31" tall, but the lock part has to be more like 36" in order to work properly. The way our stairs are, my husband had to buy another board and rig it to the staircase to make sure the whole thing works like it should. That said, now that it's installed, it works beautifully and will get the job done keeping our kiddos safe.
customer_reviews.author: C. Schuette

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my office secure.
customer_reviews.text: My office is at the end of a hallway and has access to the outside which includes a sizable dog door that my toddler loves to use even when it's really cold outside. This gate has so far been perfect at keeping my toddler out of that room which also prevents incidents of trying to "feed" my printer or creating new "tattoo sleeves" with my sizable collection of markers. So far, he hasn't been able to defeat this gate as he has done with many others. I'm sure the day will come, but it was worth every penny to get a few weeks of peace of mind in those moments where I need to use the restroom or cook meals.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 year review - Very sturdy, 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this gate at the bottom of our stairs for almost exactly 5 years and I definitely give it 5 stars. Originally purchased to keep our dog from going up stairs, our almost 3 year (35lbs) has been “riding” it for over a year now and finally broke...but I honestly think that is still proving to be pretty darn sturdy!! *she always gets in trouble for playing on the gate, but she keeps at it SMH* I can’t say much for the installation as my husband did that part, but he had no complaints. We plan to get an identical gate to replace it with. Perfect gate for the bottom of a stairwell.
customer_reviews.author: L. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING! The BEST! LOVE IT! RECCOMEND!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what an AMAZING choice 2 make the purchase to serve the purpose I needed it to! It is perfect for keeping ♡my little prince charming♡ from being able to go to the stairs that he could have fallen down!!! ••THANK GOD•• this GATE is their to STOP that from happening!! Its extremely STRONG! STURDY! SUPER EASY to INSTALL! Can unlock it with 1 hand! [have to be an adult, and tall enough to do so!] MOST DEFINITELY WORTH the PRICE! 》*EXTREMELY HAPPY*《 with the PRODUCT! I LOVE IT! I would n have reccomend this to many others! I give it 10+ ☆s! It's been {litterally} a LIFE SAVER!
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: Not auto closing, sturdy enough, require some skills to install
customer_reviews.text: The product feels a little less beefy than the other gate that we own. The instructions are ok and has a nice template for the drilling. But I think it helps installation if you are slightly handy to find like studs and using a machine drill. The closing mechanism is good for fooling children. In my opinion but it’s a bit hard to open when you are coming up the stairs and opening the gate towards you. It doesn’t automatically close so you will have to remember to do that. But all I’m all so far the gate seems ok we gave it a good wiggle and it’s seems sturdy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Happy7046

customer_reviews.title: Very nice gate once installed.
customer_reviews.text: Had difficulty installing the gate mounting pieces as they are not intuitive at all. But after a trial and error period I was able to discern the method to the madness. I works well for when we need to segregate the dogs for whatever reason. Biggest bonus is the lack of the usual tripping hazard present across the floor of most other gates. It was such a tripping accident for my dear wife that caused me to purchase and install this item. Don't know how it would function on stairs but it works across the doorway from the kitchen into the den when needed.
customer_reviews.author: John B. Williams Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Our Needs
customer_reviews.text: The gate was just what we needed - not only to keep our dogs off the steep stairwell, but will keep visitors safe from an open stairwell a few feet from the front door. The install was a bit complicated as we had to connect the banister with a wall on the opposite side - while keeping the gate in line. We did a bit of jerry-rigging, and it works perfectly. So happy to find a gate that opens fully and swings both ways.
customer_reviews.author: DKM

customer_reviews.title: Life Changer
customer_reviews.text: Make your life a little easier. Confine your puppies and not your family. Simple installation with Philips screw driver (manual or electric), some type of tape (scotch, duct or electric) to secure placement paper to mark where to mount hinge & lock brackets. Gate has option of one way or two ways of swing. Easy one hand operation of opening/closing. Know that gate seemingly will not open full 90*. Almost but not full. Not a game changer for me. Read instructions.
customer_reviews.author: DenS

customer_reviews.title: Good Gate Overall
customer_reviews.text: This product was much more difficult to install than I expected. I almost returned it because it didn’t fit our stairwell as well as I expected. I ended up having to install 1”x1” braces on both sides of the wall at the top of our stairs instead of installing this in the stairwell. The height of our railing and baseboards prevented me from installing inside the stairwell without major modifications to the walls that I was not willing to make. Once installed, the gate works amazing. Only complaint is that you have slam the gate in order to get it to easily latch.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Broken Rung
customer_reviews.text: I liked this gate for about a year, but then the lock mechanism started getting stuck and finicky. After less than two years of regular but appropriate use one of the metal rungs actually snapped off of the gate. There are now jagged metal edges on the top and bottom bars of the gate, and a large hole easily big enough for a child to slip through. It is absolutely not safe for my children anymore. I am giving two stars instead of one only because it did its job all right for the first year.
customer_reviews.author: nmlwilson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the dogs
customer_reviews.text: This gate is used for my 80lb dogs and is holding up great! It's tall enough they don't try to jump over it and sturdy enough that it doesn't accidentally open when they put their front paws on it. I did mount it to the walls for extra security as pressure mounted gates seem to loosen up over time. Very easy to open and close one handed. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: TAmi

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, safe, easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: This gate is so very sturdy, even more so than a similar one of the same brand I had purchased 3 years ago! Installation was straightforward but having 2 people made it very easy. Make sure to install into a stud or other solid wood surface as the kit does not include drywall anchors. I really appreciate the updated hardware that has extra safety measures to keep the gate from swinging out over the stairs. This gate seems ultra safe and very child-proof (my 7 year old niece can open other gates but not this). Lastly, this is a very nice looking gate that coordinates well with our oil-rubbed bronze colored metal banisters and handrails!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie B Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy gate that’s easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gate. We have it at the top of our stairs. Screws into the wall and the latch clicks into place. We have really put pressure on it, and the latch holds well. Easy to install. You have to push in a button while pulling up on the rail to get it un-latched. That was a little tricky at first. Maybe because we are new parents, lacking sleep, and fighting with it while a child is wailing in our ears. Now that we’ve got the hang of it—the gate and our sweet sweet child, it defeats us much less than it once did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not easy to install. Read the fine print before ordering.
customer_reviews.text: I think the manufacturer really missed the mark on advertising this gate. The small print says you cannot mount into drywall or plaster, not even with anchors. They also tout easy installation which is also incorrect. They state that hardware included is for mounting on wood or metal. You'd think it's heavy duty hardware but that's not the case. I stripped two screws trying to get them into a stud. I was not able to install this gate and because of this I'm using the easy return feature which I hope is easier than attempting to install this gate.
customer_reviews.author: Jodie

customer_reviews.title: Straightforward installation, sturdy unit, good value.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well thought out product. The parts are laid out, including a wall template for screw placement to mount hinges and latches. Detailed instructions--read and know them first. My unit is to keep the dogs off the little pool deck, and it serves well. The gate can be set up to swing in either direction. The instructions caution NOT to allow gate to swing out over steps. The gate feels solid and should be a fine addition to homes where such a thing is desired. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Horny Trumpeter

customer_reviews.title: Good gate
customer_reviews.text: Great gate although a tad difficult to install. My brother came over to my house to help me out and between the two of us we got it done with 3 out of 4 of the anchors/latches even and aligned correctly on the first go. Had it installed for a few months now and I am very pleased with it and it’s durability. My only suggestion would be to get some lock tight goo to put on the adjustable spacers/screws. As the gate opens and closes they loosen up and make it difficult to latch and unlatch. Lock tight or some such will take care of the issue no problem.
customer_reviews.author: R. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Impressive gate
customer_reviews.text: I bought and installed this gate months ago and never gave a thought to rating it. It was installed to prevent young grandchildren from falling down a flight of stairs. I also have a 140 lb Great Dane and we use this gate to separate him from the little kids when he gets too rambunctious. This gate has been able to stand up to the dog literally hanging on the gate so he doesn't miss out on anything. Not even the slightest evidence that this gate has been damaged or is even close to having issues. Very impressed with the abuse it can take and keep on working.
customer_reviews.author: Doug S

customer_reviews.title: Only for top of stairs
customer_reviews.text: It appears to be good quality. But it will only work well on straight walls. Installing the gate at the bottom of the stairs was extremely difficult! It took over two hours and it was a kluge job, see pictures. Would have sent it back but was too far into the installation and really needed the gate now. Please note the clamps that should be made for adjustment don't . Note from pics the bars MUST be next to each other are the clamps will not fit. The bars are 3.25 inches apart, so one looses 3.25 inches of adjustment. Don't buy for bottom of stairs!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great at first
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these gates, when we first installed they worked great! after a week or two the spring came out of one of the buttons (where you push down to release the gate) and since then i cannot shut it properly. The other gate we installed worked great at first too, but now we cant just shut as they do not fall directly into the lock tracks (if that makes sense)..we have to take the care to make sure that are properly in place and secure. When they are closed they are very sturdy its just really annoying that i cant just shut both of the gates we got.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa P

customer_reviews.title: Our blind dog’s safety net
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this gate on our deck to protect our going-blind dog from accidentally launching himself into the air and breaking his neck. How well it fares in the weather is yet to be seen, but it seems sturdy and fairly well-made. DO NOT rely on the templates that come with it. I used them and regretted it. You’re better off using it for the hinge side, Then hang the gate with the fasteners on the other side, and mark the wall where they need to go. The template will have you drilling holes that are about a half inch too far over.
customer_reviews.author: cat

customer_reviews.title: Gate nice - Installation terrible!!!
customer_reviews.text: I SO want to give this gate a 5 start rating. It is super sturdy, beautiful, and a nice height. But please be aware; it was a BEAR to install and get all the connections to line up properly so the gate can function. And there is NO nice easy close like it shows in the video. It has to be pretty much slammed to close. With that said it would be very sturdy and hard for kids to get through. But if I had it to do again I would not buy this knuckle-buster.
customer_reviews.author: B. Cobb

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, not climbable for our baby giant
customer_reviews.text: We ordered two of these before our son was born and installed one a few months ago. He’s 14 months old now and wants to be everywhere. We LOVE how these look! Our only complaints are: install was a bit tricky (but sturdy result) AND the kit for the second gate was not complete :( Some parts are missing, but it’s been 15 months since we bought the gate itself so we feel silly reaching out now. Anyway, I just recommended this gate to a mom tonight and I realized we never left a review! I also need to add: our boy is TALLLL but there’s no climbing this gate! Haha :)
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Strong, perfect for stairs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the top of the stairs. I was terrified that my 2 year old would fall down the stairs. Since my bedroom door is right next to the stairs. There is nothing to trip on and even tho we dont use it as much as I thought we would its very strong. And she cant open it at all. Sometimes I cant open it lol which is better than it being easy to open. Perfect gate. And well worth the price. It's also adjustable so if I wanted to move it somewhere else I could. Definitely happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: MraulTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: I don't trust it, hard to open
customer_reviews.text: The install was pretty easy, but I don't like it. It's hard to open, especially one handed coming upstairs. It doesn't open the full 90 degrees and the pins that lock move if the nut isn't tight... and it seems like that nut needs tightened alot. With a climbing 2 year old and 9 month old it just doesn't make me not worry. It's working for now but I am looking for a better option. I will say the finish is nice, it came quickly and with no damage.
customer_reviews.author: Jess M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We got two one for too and bottom of stairs, they worked great and matched our stair rails they are easy to open for my 6 year old but the baby can’t even try it so love that. Elderly may have a little trouble because it requires some strength and doesn’t automatically lock back but mom is figuring it out lol. Great value too.
customer_reviews.author: Tisha V

customer_reviews.title: Very Good, but I had to do some cutting.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice gate & I would buy it again for sure. With my install I had to cut the plastic pieces that holds front and back of gate together. Things will be smooth if your gate spindles all line up. "If" they dont you will have to trim the plastic connecting piece or fasten the front and back of gate together using another method. This is the reason for 4 stars instead of 5. If you dont mind some possible trimming its a very nice gate.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: solid product, would be even better with improved installation and user manual
customer_reviews.text: i bought this gate after another gate didnt meet my expectations. the only downside with this is it requires drilling holes in the wall. however it ensures very sturdy installation. very happy about it. gave lower rating on the installation mostly because the pre-measured hole guides did not work very well for my case. a better user and installation manual would go a long way, especially the screws that is used the for fine adjustment of the length of the gate.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.D

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these to use in our home to corral our very adventurous 10 month old. My husband had installed gates and other safety devices all over our house. This was just awful. He spent 4 hours trying to follow the directions and install the gate. It was flimsy, would not line up, and dried even his heroic attempts to make it work. Stay away!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anne Marie Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this, hard to install & to hard to open!
customer_reviews.text: Wow where to start with this gate! It's mostly plastic, when you read directions says can't be used on anything but wood how many homes have wood at bottom of stairs? Not us. So husband has to rig it to fit! After 2 hours of install we have a gate now to use is another problem! So hard to open I can't almost open this it's very tough and hard. Not good for daily use. For the price I would never recommend or buy this item again.
customer_reviews.author: megan mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy gate, a little tricky to install on a winding staircase
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice sturdy gate made of metal. Installation wasn’t very easy for top of the stairs because we have a banister on one side and a curved surface on the other. On top of that we had to install it diagonally because the bigger banister was not directly across the wall. But with some critical thinking this gate was a success. We did use a banister install kit which made it a lot easier and even with that we had to drill into the banister a little.
customer_reviews.author: Bermet Suominen

customer_reviews.title: Pet gate for our deck
customer_reviews.text: Got this gate for our deck that we closed in so our dog could be out there. I love that it swings wide easily and does NOT have a bottom rail. I knew it was inexpensive but had features I liked. The close latches are plastic and didn't last 2 days so we just use a small bunji cord if we need to lock it closed but the way we mounted it, opened gate coming in the dog can't open it anyway. It is a cheap gate that is doing all we need.
customer_reviews.author: Spirit47

customer_reviews.title: This might be the perfect gate!
customer_reviews.text: I've had the pressure gates, the plastic swing gates, the wood gates and none of those compare to this. Install was pretty easy, it comes with a nice template you can tape on the wall to mark all your spots. That did not work for me though due to the size of my floor trim but if you or your husband can use a tape measure you'll be fine! The only issue I have now is my dogs aren't happy they no longer have free reign of the downstairs anymore, LOL
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Hard to install and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This gate is very difficult to install. There are 4 points of contact. Unless your walls are perfectly square and aligned, you will have to make a bunch of little adjustments. Additionally if the walls shift, say from humidity, you will need to readjust. The plastic locks are also very flimsy. We had a gate installed less the 1 year and the lock brock and will no longer self close. It still works but you must manually lock it which means it's no longer the self-close.
customer_reviews.author: JVM

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, works as described!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for the bottom of our stairway to keep our granddaughters from exploring without us. It felt sturdy after installation and even though the pieces are plastic, they are very sturdy plastic. We purchased another brand for a different hallway, and it feels very flimsy. I bought a second straight gate for our hallway. That also feels sturdy and the plastic is thick. It still took a while to install, but luckily my husband is very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Donna from the desert

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit all widths from 28.68" - 47.85"
customer_reviews.text: Installed quickly and easily on my 41" wide stairs. Major issue is that when setting the width, the vertical bars need to end up in front of each other. If you look in the picture by her hand, that clamp which keeps the two sections from moving is exactly the width of the vertical bars. So, if you installation has the bars from one section in the middle of the bars in another section, that clamp will not install, and your gate sections will not be secure.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: High hopes
customer_reviews.text: We had a hard time finding a gate that would fit the width of our stairs, so we were very happy to find this gate. It was easy enough to install. However, the quality let us down. The latch is plastic and only lasted one day. We had to order a replacement latch directly from the vendor. We have no other options at this time, so we have to make sure we are extra careful when opening and closing the gate. There are times when it locks without problems and other days when it gives us a hard time. Therefroe, I had to change the score from three stars to two stars.
customer_reviews.author: Marily

customer_reviews.title: What a pain!
customer_reviews.text: A NIGHTMARE to install. The guide thru give you is terrible, my husband needed to use the leveler and quadruple check all the measurements. The biggest problem is that the 4 parts you attach to the wall are not connected giving absolutely no room for error. It mostly works where toy can open with one hand, but it gets stuck about 25% of the time. It looks great and was wide enough for thre top of our stairs, but I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Nathalie

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it DOES fit 48” doorways
customer_reviews.text: Anyone telling you this doesn’t fit ANY doorway up to 48” isn’t reading the directions, or watching a YT install video. It ABSOLUTELY fits. What they’re not bothering to do is unwind the spindles at EACH end of the gate, which adds over 5” to the gate to get it to cover the max 48”. Also I see some people complaining about sturdiness...all I can say to that is hogwash. They aren’t following directions. It’s rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: Mary M.

customer_reviews.title: Very safe/secure product!
customer_reviews.text: Ive got a 22 y/o, 16y/o, 13 y/o and 1 y/o, ive used a lot of different "baby items" over 22 years. This gate is hands down the sturdiest, most child proof gate i have ever used or seen. The only con? The bottom hinge design required i remove or notch the baseboard to mount it low enough. Nothing a coping saw wont cure, just keep the piece and glue it back when they outgrow the need for a gate.
customer_reviews.author: PaveHawk Gunner

customer_reviews.title: Complicated install doesn't fit all openings
customer_reviews.text: This gate requires hard installation into a wall - on both sides. And it did not fit my space - was installing at top of a stairwell. I ended up buying a Munchkin brand from Home Depot that had an actual hinge and was removable. The hinge allowed for more flexibility to position it at the top of the stairs if there were hand railings interfering with usual installation. The Munchkin was significantly more expensive but the gate is easy to use, attractive and can slide in and out of its installed location should you only need baby gate protection intermittently.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: The included screw are crap
customer_reviews.text: While installing this gate we drilled pilot holes, but every screw we used that came with this gate broke (the head snapped off). We were luckily able to extract the screws using vice grips and then use bronze deck screws to install the gate. I would recommend you skip the bag of included screws (except maybe the 2 short screws for putting the caps on the hinges) and use screws that aren't going to break on you.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: A little short for stair top. But great quality & functionality!
customer_reviews.text: This gate was pretty easy to install. They give great drilling stencils to line up both sides evenly. But the gate is kind of short. I feel like it’s about hip length (and can’t be installed higher or babies could slip underneath) and you could fall right over it. Should be a little taller. But overall keeps the babies safe from the stairs. Easy latch to open. Self closing. Very sturdy hinges (which was big for us since our other gates kept cracking at the hinges).
customer_reviews.author: AngelaC

customer_reviews.title: Great gate so far
customer_reviews.text: Using this outside on our deck. I love the way the gate looks. Really sleek and almost inconspicuous. Did a lot of research for a gate that won’t rust outside (although we will prob bring it in during the frigid winters on the Midwest). Based on another review, it looks like the gate held up outside so we’re hoping ours does the same. Will follow up down the road. Also, can’t really comment on the instillation as my husband did that. But he did finish it during our son’s nap with time to spare. So it took less than 2 hours.
customer_reviews.author: a.s.

customer_reviews.title: Not safe.
customer_reviews.text: The look is nice, but the safety of this gate is sketchy. If you don’t have a stud to install it into, you HAVE to buy anchors to keep it from coming out of the wall when opening the gate. We had to reinstall it several times before buying anchors. The gates (bought two for top and bottom) also does not fit between our stair rails and floor board, so we had to improvise and put the gates in the walkways to the stairs. I would definitely not buy these again. Look elsewhere, there are better ones at similar prices.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley W

customer_reviews.title: Babyproof & worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: There isn't anything that I didn't like, about this gate. I did mark and drill holes into the wood to make it easier to put in the screws. And I was able to install it on my own. It's a gate that is easy to open. Just press the tab, pull up the bar, and push out, to open. To close, just pull up the bar, press tab, and drop it back in the slots. I can do this with one hand, no problem. My toddler gbabies are not coordinated enough to open the gate. So yes, it is babyproof! It's worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the corgi, pitbull, & great dane in the living room
customer_reviews.text: We needed a gate to keep the corgi, pitbull, & great dane in the living room to prevent them from getting into trouble when we aren't watching. We had an all wooden one first but the corgi karate chopped it & broke it when he wanted to get out of the living room. This gate is super sturdy & the corgi hasn't been able to jump into it and break it. I highly recommend this if you need something sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Loutzenhiser

customer_reviews.title: Escape artist pooch proof
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to hold back a Houdini beagle and a 80lb baby lab...this is perfect! I ordered 2 for each entrance into my living room and I had them both installed within an hour. I live in a house built in the 30’s so nothing is absolutely perfectly square and my gates still work great. I ended up measuring up 3” from the floor on both of mine to make them a little taller so a certain escape artist beagle couldn’t reach the top but he also can fit his plump self under it. It also helped the gate to be more at a comfortably reachable level.
customer_reviews.author: Hope Schardt

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and nice appearance
customer_reviews.text: The templates included for the gate are very helpful and make installation pretty seamless once you figure out your placement. We used anchors and installed directly to drywall just above the trim for our stairs and it has held up nicely thus far, even with our 25lb toddler hanging and pulling on it. The gate is a little bit loud when locking/unlocking so we leave it open when our son is napping. But, it is easy to open and close with one hand while holding a baby, dog, or other items so I can’t complain there.
customer_reviews.author: Jade R.

customer_reviews.title: Questionable Screw Choice
customer_reviews.text: The gate seems to have a sturdy design. However, the mounting screws are very long. While it may sound very secure, the real problem is it also means you have to get very deep into the wall. I was able to make 3/4 of the way before the screw resisted really hard and within a few more tries the screw was busted. To get the broken one out I essentially made a small hole in my wall and will have to repair that later. I have used other gates whose screws are half as long. Maybe this is a safe design but it made installation really difficult. It might also work better if the screws are of better quality.
customer_reviews.author: F. W.

customer_reviews.title: Latch mechanism isn’t too good
customer_reviews.text: The gate is made very well except the hardware is made of plastic. I do not like the latching mechanism. The gate needs to be lifted to unlatch. With time I’m sure the plastic hinges will break. This will fit a 48” opening without any problem as one reviewer mentioned. I bought an opened box and saved $. I chose this model because it did not have a tripping hazard as the other gates had. Overall, I’m ok with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dann Marr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love these gates. They are very sturdy very easy to use. We have been using for 5 months now and no issues, as good as the day they were installed. I had a tricky staircase at the top where the two walls did not align. So the hardware allowed us to mount it on the side of one wall and front of the other (see photos).
customer_reviews.author: Gina Giambalvo

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time and money!
customer_reviews.text: The screws all broke or were stripped on the first try to set. This was frustrating and can't call until tomorrow to hopefully get replacement screws that aren't garbage. I am not sure we will even be able to get the broken screws out of the wood on the stairs. Very dissatisfied. This is why we didnt go with a cheaper gate and still got burned. Do yourself a favor and try a different brand/gate.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Good gate while it last.
customer_reviews.text: I order the gate early January and It already broke at the end of June. I ordered this gate to keep a Boxer out of the Den, Dinning room and Den. The gate worked great until the welds started to break on be. I think this gate was a little too much for a Boxer. If you are getting this gate for a toddler or small dog this gate should last a while.
customer_reviews.author: S. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Hard to install, good once it's in place
customer_reviews.text: This was very hard to install, because the clamps that hold the two halves of the railing prevent it from being truly adjustable. Used duct tape to hold the railing segments in correct position. Seems to be working fine, and is easy to open to close once it is properly sized.
customer_reviews.author: J Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Great quality gate for stairs.
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for something super sturdy to keep our toddler from accessing these stairs. It took a little finagling but my husband was able to install this gate perfectly. It’s very sturdy, I was pleasantly surprised because I found it for under $20 and thought why not. I could put a lot of weight on it and it will not budge. I no longer fear my child will fall down them. We love North State products and have 2 of their super yards. They deliver great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tiki Sauve

customer_reviews.title: Not for just anyone
customer_reviews.text: Great product overall. Given I'm more than fairly handy around the house, it was pretty easy to get done, took about an hour or so. Tools needed: stud finder (definitely don't recommend drywall anchors) drill drill bits (I had to drill through some metal drywall corners) tape measure other various tools (I used a oscillating saw to shave down one of the plastic brackets) If you're looking for a good, quality product for the price. You've found it. If you're looking for an easy install (if you have no experience working around the house), this one will cause some frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good gate for wider openings
customer_reviews.text: I like the gate itself. I deduced 1 star because I had difficulty using the assembly fittings. As you can see in the picture when I don’t use them the gate “bends” because I think the upper latch or the upper hinge needs to be higher. I did use the templates and pulled them taut but I was reluctant to put more holes in my wall or post. Ultimately I took the assembly fittings off and it works very well. Still very sturdy and we can slide it to the shortest position to make it easier to “store” when open. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: READ THE DIRECTIONS!!
customer_reviews.text: PLEASE read the directions or call the customer service number on the front of the directions. They answer right away and are super helpful! If your gate doesn’t have the bars line up perfectly there is a solution. The spindles that actually lock into the brackets extend out and lock to change the width of your gate! We didn’t read the directions, and regretted it. Once you actually follow their directions this gate works perfectly! Install is easy too!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura A

customer_reviews.title: Stop thinking about it, buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Hubby liked it after he installed and he hates half of the things I buy from amazon after assembling lol. Our baby boy is starting to crawl and we needed something that matched the home decor but was effective. This did that. It’s sleek, sturdy, and decor worthy. However! I wouldn’t use it for large pets. It would work but they may break it over time. It’s good for a babies/toddlers and smaller pets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon addict

customer_reviews.title: It’s “okay”
customer_reviews.text: The increments in which the gate expands are large causing you to unthread the hinge and lock bolts a fair amount to account for the difference. The screws that come with them gate are perhaps the lowest quality hardware I’ve seen to date, they arrived bent. Not just one, but all the screws had a bend in them which would have made them very difficult to install.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Seda

customer_reviews.title: ... different gates and this one is bar far our favorite. It swings open and closes easily with one ...
customer_reviews.text: We got 3 different gates and this one is bar far our favorite. It swings open and closes easily with one hand, and doesn't have a bottom bar like the other ones we did have which sometimes becomes a tripping hazard. And it completely opens, which makes it easy to go through especially if you are carrying the baby in your arms. Attaches to the wall instead of adjustable tension springs, and is more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: MDK

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but hard to install and keep aligned
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, nice and wide but about 1 inch less wide than the product information. VERY difficult to install despite an enclosed paper template. Closing mechanism has very tight tolerance and easily becomes misaligned. But when properly adjusted, it does its job well on the stairs and is very sturdy. Just don't forget since you're not supposed to let it swing over the stairs, it swings out at the top impeding traffic if you want to keep it open.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L. DeBard

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, top of stair gate, works for my little T-Rex
customer_reviews.text: Installation is quite easy. Gate closes great and nice and easy to open and shut for the adult. Some gates are a pain for adult and I worried my husband would complain but its good on both ends, keeps granddaughter safe and husband not frustrated. Best part no bar at bottom of gate which can be a hazard for adults. I'm more than happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Maddy

customer_reviews.title: Latch is crap. Hard to install. Missed return period
customer_reviews.text: Latching is horrible. Difficult to install. If you do not get everything to align perfectly it will not latch or close well. I've been a handy kind of man for 20 years and I've never been so frustrated trying to get it mounted on the wall perfectly aligning with the other side that has the latch. I had a very day install with the safety first brand no problem but this ones latching system is just sh**.
customer_reviews.author: Tcabez

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: My husband had some troubles installing this product, but he is also bad at following instructions. LOL. The only thing I don’t like about this product is how the gate door doesn’t open out to at least 90-degrees. I’d say the gate door opens out to 70-degrees. Other than that, it is a sturdy gate and keeps the little one from going up the stairs.
customer_reviews.author: MaoX

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: Solid, secure and nothing on floor to trip over..... rungs close enough together to keep 8 wk old mini labradoodle safe. The only thing to keep in mind is to follow directions exactly: there is a 'clamp' that attaches to the gate that needs to fit in the space between rungs. Adjustments can be made on each end of the gate that allows you to install the clamp correctly and still fit your opening. I first fitted the gate without reading instructions.... to save time: follow instructions; you'll be glad u did
customer_reviews.author: cws

customer_reviews.title: Nice gate, but rethink if you have trim in your house.
customer_reviews.text: Finally decided on this gate after weeks of searching for a gate to prevent my puppy from getting into the living room while also being easy enough for my kids to open. Kids couldn't figure out how to open it so they were attempting to climb over it as soon as we put it up. Puppy can fit right under it because we have trim in our house, so it leaves good 6-8 inch gap at the bottom. I'm sure it'll work well for lots of other people, but unfortunately, it just doesn't work for our home/situation :/ Back to the drawing board.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Decent Gate but HORRIBLE Install Instructions
customer_reviews.text: Debated a 3 star as this thing was a GIANT pain to install. I don't have kids, but I have pushy, muscular dogs. This is like the 5th gate I've installed over the years, so I think I have a thing or 2 to say about them. Other than VERY poor installation instructions, I'm fairly happy with operation after a few weeks. Looks nice, operates smoothly. I have it outdoors in Chicago so it hasn't had the polar vortex test yet. For the reasonable price, I'm pretty happy with it and it's doing a good job of keeping 100+ lbs of dogs on the porch.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby Ruby Red

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit difficult to install - kind of like hanging a door. You have to get it just right for it to work properly. We installed ours with the bottom hinge above the baseboard. Our little boy loves to stand on the bottom and hold on to the bars - yikes. We're working that out now. Overall it's 1,000,000 X better that the removable ones
customer_reviews.author: TAC

customer_reviews.title: Had to get creative with the install
customer_reviews.text: Had to get creative on the install, but we're very happy with the look and function. Our front staircase was not ideal for a baby gate. Maybe someone in a similar position will get some ideas for mounting from my photos.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hontz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a pet gate
customer_reviews.text: This looks good and was fairly easy to install. We are using it at the top of the stairs on our deck to keep our 60 pound dog in. It’s perfect for that. I would NEVER use it for a child at the top of stairs. And, I doubt I’d use for a child it at the bottom. It would be far too easy for a child to shake it until it pops open. And if a child stood on it, it would break.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our stairs!
customer_reviews.text: This product was great! We got it so that our pups would not wander upstairs when we don’t want them to, and it definitely gets the job done. I only gave four stars out of five for the easiness to install, only because I couldn’t do it on my own, but my husband was able to do it. It just had a little bit more to it than what I think I expected, but I definitely recommend this gate.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Vance

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and looks nice
customer_reviews.text: Our cats eat downstairs. Our dog likes to steal their food. ☺ We installed this gate and problem was solved. The cats either go under or jump over the fence. It's very well made. Opens and closes easily and has a latching mechanism that works well. Other than our dog being sad that she can't raid the cat bowl there have been no issues.
customer_reviews.author: flowergirl712

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality!
customer_reviews.text: We have always bought gates that were pressure installed, so we wouldn't have to drill holes in the wall. But after our kids turned into the Hulk we decided we needed a more sturdy gate. This gate has exceeded all of our expectations. Installation took us about 30 mins to get the right measurement for the holes to line up. I 100% recommend this gate. We love it! Especially the fact that the entire gate swings open. Say goodbye to those tiny openings in baby gates that make you feel super fat haha. Hallelujah!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The PERFECT gate! for our needs at least...
customer_reviews.text: This gate fit the bill for our needs. We have an opening from our living space into our mudroom with no door, which we like. But trying to keep our dogs contained in the mudroom at certain times with a removable baby gate was literally leaving its mark. This gate is light, wide enough for larger openings and swings both ways! It's got a baby proof latch, but our 6 and 8 year olds were able to learn how to use it themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Joleen Denman

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy baby gate!
customer_reviews.text: We bought the metal gate as it would be at the top of the stairs, and we heard that would be most appropriate. Our stairs' opening is ~42" wide, and the gate was adjustable to that width. It took ~1 hr. to install. The gate opens towards you and is super sturdy. You need both hands to open (one hand in middle and another to lift the door from the latch - most likely for safety purposes). We did put foam padding around the bars, so that baby wouldn't bump her head, but that's up to you. We highlight recommend this gate!
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Strong and sturdy gate
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this gate to prevent my one year old nephew from having access to the stairs at my home. This gate is strong and easy to use once installed. It was a little troublesome to install and I had to use drywall anchors, which are not included, but I would recommend. My nephew is a little over 30 lbs and he stands on the gate (puts his feet between the bars) and the gate doesn’t move, or bend. I would highly recommend this gate if you have small children.
customer_reviews.author: Bubbaa

customer_reviews.title: Love this gate!
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been great. I wanted a gate that didn’t have a threshold on it. This one is great! It came with templates that made it super easy to install and the get works wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni Gomila

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality
customer_reviews.text: This gate is horrible. It looks nice and would love if it worked better. The latch that holds gate in is very finicky and the metal will easily get stuck over the plastic so that it doesn’t latch at all. We have multiple stair gates and this is the nicest looking but absolutely the least functional and safe. I would not recommend to anyone. Even for pets
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Guillory

customer_reviews.title: NOT for kid stair safety
customer_reviews.text: Terrible gate for baby stair safety. Even when it's perfectly aligned, the latch system is way to easy to open, all you have to do is lift is slightl. You don't have to use the release at all to open the gate with minimum effort. Even if the latch system did work, if you apply a little pressure to the center joint of the gate where it slides, it will come right out as well, also rendering the gate useless. Very unhappy with this purchase. Probably fine for dogs, NOT good for children (mine is 2yrs).
customer_reviews.author: christie

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Overall very disappointed with this purchase. We really needed something simple for our porch just to keep dogs away from the cat food however within just a couple short days it’s already having issues opening & closing, so I’m pretty sure it unfortunately won’t last if this is already happening. I liked the concept of the latches being screwed in and it swinging open it’s just unfortunately a poorly made product.
customer_reviews.author: David Washburn

customer_reviews.title: Installation is it's fatal flaw
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy but difficult to align properly. The paper helps but what ends up happening is it tilts to one side or the screw drifts a little bit and it's no longer aligned. It also doesn't work on drywall, my child bangs it loose. So if mounting by the stairs the hand rail support beam needs to align with a wood stud in the wall. For people stuck with drywall like me, they will have to screw in a piece of wood to the wall which is an eyesore.
customer_reviews.author: RedBaron

customer_reviews.title: We like this gate
customer_reviews.text: It's nice that the entire gate opens and that there is no threshold for dirt to gather under. We have a 75lb. German Shepherd that jumps up on it daily and it's holding strong so far. We've had it a few months now I think. Our shepherd did learn to chew the bottom plastic clips that hold the gate in the width you set. She hasn't learned that the clips are on top too so thus far the gate is still sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy, Sturdy, easy to install, looks nice
customer_reviews.text: I liked that the door gets screwed to the wall it feels so sturdy and needed because my son is sometimes in a rush and tends to be harsh but I know the door can handle it. We use it to keep our dog downstairs and also from having babies or toddlers from playing on the stair works great and will recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Salas

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Secure Fit!
customer_reviews.text: We installed this gait across a doorway to keep our puppy out of the cat food/litter box area in our laundry room. It looks so nice and was easy to install. We did wall mount and it is very secure. We installed it high enough that cat can go under it, plus if we leave it unlocked she now has learned to open it with her head/feet. For the price this is perfect and we are going to buy another one for the stairway.
customer_reviews.author: SavyThinker

customer_reviews.title: Installation is the problem
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's a decent gate, but the installation was extremely frustrating. Bottom line - do not use the paper installation templates that tell you where to mount the wall hardware. They do not align properly. I learned this the hard way and now have several mis-drilled holes in my pretty wall. Attach the lower mount on the "hinge" side then have someone hold the gate level while you determine the right placement and then attach the upper mount on the "hinge" side. Once those are in place, it is pretty easy to get the hardware on the "latch" side positioned properly.
customer_reviews.author: ComputerNerd

customer_reviews.title: Gate works well. However, drill template is worthless.
customer_reviews.text: Gate works well. However the drill template is worthless. The vertical alignment is off and the center line is also off. If you use the template the gate won't latch correctly and may be slightly askew. Start with bottom swing hinge to set height, then do top swing hinge, next do top latch mechanism, finally bottom catch. Make sure to account for slight gate sag. A little sag is okay so the posts rest in the latch and catch securely. Own and installed 4 of these. One gate's latch (4 years old) broke after heavy use. You can buy a new hardware set from Northern States, if needed.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Best gate
customer_reviews.text: I’ve actually bought a couple of these gates over the years and it’s a great product! I plan to buy more for other areas in my house! We recently purchased a $90 gate from Home Depot, put it up, and then decided to order another one of these gates because the $90 one is the worst gate of all time! So I recommend this one a million times over!
customer_reviews.author: STZ2017

product_meta.title: Toddleroo by North States 47.85" Wide Easy Swing & Lock Baby Gate: Ideal for Wider Areas and stairways. Hardware Mount. Fits Openings 28.68" - 47.85" Wide (31" Tall, Matte Bronze)
product_meta.description: Safety is always top of mind with your little one. Keep them safe and secure with the Toddleroo by North States® Easy Swing & Lock Gate. The sturdy steel metal construction and decorative matte bronze finish will complement any home decor while its solidly constructed from the highest-quality materials to withstand rigorous day in, day out use. Enjoy the ease of one-handed operation and the security of the safety latch design. This gate has no threshold to step over and will not swing out over stairs. Ideal for a variety of room openings or at the top of stairs measuring 28.68 to 47.85 inches wide and is 31 inches high.
feature_bullets: NEW NAME - SAME GREAT BRAND YOU TRUST:  Worry-free safety! The Easy Swing & Lock Baby Gate is built from long lasting, kid-tough heavy-duty metal with vertical bars that are difficult to climb, keeping your child safe and secure. Safe for babies ages 6-24 months

SAFE & SECURE: Keep your loved ones safe with this hardware mounted gate that's perfect for large openings and stairways. There is no threshold so there is no risk of tripping and the gate will not swing over stairs.
STYLISH AND DEPENDABLE: The matte bronze finish and durable steel construction makes this gate durable and easy to use. The simple and elegant design will complement any home decor.

LOADED WITH CONVENIENT FEATURES: This gate opens effortlessly with one-hand operation and swings closed and locks with a gentle push. The gate only swings in one direction to avoid the danger of swinging over stairs. When not in use, the gate can be completely removed from the hardware mounts.
ADJUSTABLE FOR A VARIETY OF SPACES: This gate is 31 inches tall and designed to fit room openings 28.68 inches to 47.85 inches wide.
